text: WTW 161 LINEAR ALGEBRA / LINEÊRE ALGEBRA STUDY GUIDE 2013 / STUDIEHANDLEIDING 2013 The purpose of this study guide is to guide you through this course. Die doel van hierdie studiehandleiding is om jou deur hierdie kursus te lei. Prescribed Textbooks / Voorgeskrewe handboeke Larson & Falvo, Elementary Linear Algebra, 7th Edition Stewart, Calculus, Early Transcendentals, 7th Edition Lecturers / Dosente Name Room Office number email Prof A F Harding 1-46 012 4202738 ansie.harding@up.ac.za (Koördineerder / Co-ordinator) Ms Y Dinga 1-22 012 4204323 yollanda.dinga@up.ac.za Ms E Dreyer 1-27 012 4203575 ezanda.dreyer@up.ac.za Mr M Richards 2-35 012 420 2485 mark.richards1989@yahoo.com Ms AJ Ostaszewicz 1-21 012 4203994 ania.ostaszewicz@up.ac.za Mr H Wiggins 2-6 012 4205872 harry.wiggins@up.ac.za Content / Inhoud General Information 2 Algemene inligting 3 Module objectives & Module outcomes 4 Module doelwitte & Module uitkomstes 5 Theme 1 6 Tema 1 6 Theme 2 9 Tema 2 9 Theme 3 17 Tema 3 17 Theme 4 21 Tema 4 21 wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 1 General Information 1. Practical sessions You attend one practical session of one hour and a half every week. Times are given on ClickUP. At the end of every lecture unit problems are given. The unbolded problems have to be done before the time on Webassign, in preparation for the session. There will not be time to do these during the session. The bolded problems should be done in the practical sessions. 2. SMILE sessions SMILE sessions are available for this course - see ClickUP. Use this opportunity to your advantage. 3, Tests and Examiniation Semester tests will be written during the two engineering test weeks. Sem Test 1: Wed 21 August 17:30 Sem Test 2: Sat 5 October 7:30 Tests will also be written on a weekly basis during practical classes. Note that there are no sick tests. There is one special test at the end of the semester for all exceptional cases. Tests should be kept safe to use as evidence should marks be missing due to various reasons. The semester mark is calculated as follows: Semester test 1 35% Semester test 2 35% Practical tests, assignments, projects 30% 100% For permission to write the exam a semester mark of 40% is a prerequisite. The final mark is calculated as follows: Semester mark 50% Exam mark 50% and a subminimum of 40% in the exam To successfully complete this course a minimum of 50% is required for the final mark as well as a subminimum of 40% in the exam. In case of a re-examination, the final mark is calculated as follows: Semester mark 50% Re-examination mark 50% and a subminimum of 40% in the exam. 4. Test and examination instructions Read the instructions on this in the ’Timetable for 2013’. Also take note of the following: 1. Student cards must be presented on request during tests and examinations. 2. Removal of examination papers from the examination venue is a transgression of the examination rules and it is regarded as a serious offence. 3. If correction fluid is used in answering a question such an answer will not be discussed or re-evaluated. 5. Absence during tests Absence must be reported to the course coordinator within three days and can only be taken into consideration if a valid medical certificate is presented. In such a case you will qualify for the special test at the end of the semester. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 2 Algemene Inligting 1. Praktiese sessies Jy woon elke week een praktiese sessie van ’n uur en ’n half lank by. Tye word op ClickUP gegee. Aan die einde van elke lesingeenheid word probleme gegee. Die probleme in gewone druk moet vooraf op Webassign gedoen word ter voorbereiding van die sessie. Daar is nie tyd daarvoor in die sessie self nie. Die probleme in vet gedruk word in die praktiese sessie self gedoen. 2. SMILE sessies SMILE sessies is beskikbaar vir hierdie kursus - sien ClickUP. Maak hiervan gebruik tot jou eie voordeel. 3. Toetse en eksamen Semestertoetse word geskryf in die twee ingenieurstoetsweke. Sem Toets 1: Wed 21 August 17:30 Sem Toets 2: Sat 5 Oktober 7:30 Toetse word ook weekliks in praktiese klasse geskryf. Let op dat daar geen siektetoetse is nie. Daar is een enkele toets aan die einde van die semester vir alle buitengewone gevalle. Toetse moet veilig bewaar word sodat dit as bewys kan dien indien daar punte ontbreek. Semesterpunte word soos volg bereken: Semestertoets 1 35% Semestertoets 2 35% Praktiese toetse, werkstukke en projek 30% 100% Om tot die eksamen toegelaat te word, word ’n semesterpunt van minstens 40% vereis. Die finale punt word soos volg bereken: Semesterpunt 50% Eksamenpunt 50% en ’n subminimum van 40% in die eksamen. Om die kursus te slaag word ’n finale punt van minstens 50% vereis en ’n subminimum van 40% in die eksamen. In geval van ’n hereksamen, word die punte soos volg bereken: Semesterpunt 50% Hereksamenpunt 50% en ’n subminimum van 40% in die eksamen. 4. Toets- en eksameninstruksies Lees die instruksies hieroor in die ’Roosterboek vir 2013’. Let ook op die volgende: 1. Studentekaarte moet tydens toetse en eksamens op aanvraag getoon kan word. 2. Geen antwoordboeke mag deur ’n student uit ’n eksamenlokaal geneem word nie. (Dit is ’n ernstige oortreding). 3. Geen antwoord waarby korreksievloeistof gebruik is sal her-nagesien of bespreek word nie. 5. Afwesigheid tydens toetse Afwesigheid moet binne drie dae aan die kursuskoördineerder gerapporteer word en kan alleenlik in ag geneem word by voorlegging van ’n geldige mediese sertifikaat. In so ’n geval sal jy kwalifiseer vir die spesiale toets aan die einde van die semester. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 3 Module objectives � to revise your knowledge on dot product and cross product � to acquire skills for determining equations of lines and planes in space. � to acquire the skills of direct methods for solving systems of linear equations � to master matrix algebra � to discover determinants and their properties as well as their application in solving linear equations (Cramer’s Rule) � to become acquainted with complex numbers, their polar form, as well as application of De Moivre’s theorem � to factorise polynomials into indecomposable factors over the real numbers as well as over the complex numbers � to sketch conic sections Module outcomes At the end of this module you should be competent in a number of fundamental thinking skills for creative problem solving in mathematics and applications relating to linear algebra. After completion of this module you should be able to: � determine lines and planes in space for different cases � find the solution of systems of linear equations by row reduction and back substitution � explain the geometric meaning of systems of equations in three unknowns and their solutions � identify an invertible matrix and compute its inverse � expand a determinant according to any row or column � apply Cramer’s Rule in solving certain systems � perform all operations with complex numbers and to give their geometric representations � use De Moivre’s theorem for calculating the n-th roots of a given complex number and to interpret the result geometrically � use the division algoritm as well as the Remainder and Factor theorems factorise polynomials over R as well as over C � solve polynomial equations � identify and sketch conic sections In this module you have to work from your textbook and thus learn how to read mathematics, which is a skill that you will be able to apply in numerous problem solving situations during your further studies as well as in your career. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 4 Module doelwitte � om jou kennis omtrent puntproduk en kruisproduk te hersien. � om vaardighede te bekom om die vergelykings van lyne en vlakke in die ruimte te bepaal. � om vaardighede vir die direkte oplos van stelsels lineêre vergelykings te ontwikkel � om matriksalgebra te bemeester � om determinante te ontdek en te kan toepas in oplos van stelsels lineêre vergelykings (Cramer se reël) � om kennis te maak met komplekse getalle, poolvorm daarvan en De Moivre se stelling te kan toepas � om polinome te kan faktoriseer in onontbindbare polinome oor die reële en komplekse getalle � om keëlsnedes te kan skets Module uitkomste Na voltooiing van die module sal jy beskik oor vaardighede vir probleemoplossing in wiskunde en toepassingsgebiede waarvoor lineêre algebra nodig is. Jy behoort ook in staat te wees om: � lyne en vlakke in drie-dimensionele ruimte te kan bepaal vir verskillende gevalle � oplossings van stelsels lineêre vergelykings te vind deur ry-reduksie en terugsubstitusie � ’n meetkundige betekenis te heg aan drie vergelykings met drie onbekendes � inverteerbare matrikse te identifiseer en inverses te kan vind � ’n determinant volgens enige ry of kolom te kan ontwikkel, om eienskappe van determinante hiervoor te gebruik en om probleme op te los � Cramer se stelling te kan gebruik om sekere stelsels op te los � bewerkings met komplekse getalle te doen en meetkundige betekenisse daaraan te heg � De Moivre se stelling te gebruik om die n-demagswortels wortels van komplekse getalle te vind en meetkundige betekenisse daaraan te heg � die delingsalgoritme sowel as die Faktor- en Resstellings te gebruik om polinome oor R en C te faktoriseer � polinoomvergelykings op te los � keëlsnedes te identifiseer en skets Jy sal selfstandig uit die handboeke moet kan werk om te leer om wiskunde te lees en daarmee vaardighede te bekom wat jy kan toepas in verkeie probleemoplossing stituasies in jou verdere studies en in jou loopbaan. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 5 THEME 1 DOT PRODUCT, CROSS PRODUCT, LINES AND PLANES. Unit 1.1 The dot product Source: Stewart, Section 12.3, pp 800 - 806 Learning objectives On completion of this unit you should 1. be able to write down and use the definition of the dot product. 2. be able to determine the dot product of given vectors. 3. be able to write down and use the properties of the dot product. 4. be able to use the dot product to find the angle between two given vectors. 5. be able to use the dot product to determine whether two vectors are perpendicular (orthogonal). Remarks You do not have to know any proofs. Problems Stewart, Exercises 12.3 p 806: no 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 9, 11, 13, 15, 21, 23, 25 and 26. TEMA 1 PUNTPRODUK, KRUISPRODUK, LYNE EN VLAKKE Eenheid 1.1 Die puntproduk Bron: Stewart, Section 12.3 pp 800 - 806 Leerdoelwitte Na voltooiing van hierdie eenheid moet jy 1. die definisie van die puntproduk kan neerskryf en gebruik. 2. die puntproduk van gegewe vektore kan bepaal. 3. die eienskappe van die puntproduk kan neerskryf en gebruik. 4. die puntproduk kan gebruik om die hoek tussen twee gegewe vektore te bepaal. 5. die puntproduk kan gebruik om vas te stel of twee vektore loodreg (ortogonaal) is. Opmerking Jy hoef geen bewyse te ken nie. Probleme: Stewart, Exercises 12.3 p 806: no 1, 2, 5, 6, 7, 9, 11, 13, 15, 21, 23, 25 en 26. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 6 Unit 1.2 The cross product Source: Stewart, Section 12.4 pp 808 - 815 Learning objectives On completion of this unit you should 1. be able to write down and use the definition of the cross product of two vectors. 2. be able to find the cross product of two given vectors. 3. be able to write down and use the properties of the cross product. 4. be able to explain the geometric meaning of the cross product. Remarks 1. Cross products are only defined for three-dimensional vectors. 2. Note that the order of the vectors when calculating the cross product is important, whereas this is not the case when we calculate the dot product. 3. The introduction of a determinant is just to make it easier to calculate the cross product. 4. You do not have to know any proofs. Problems Stewart, Exercises 12.4 p 815 no 3, 5, 7, 13 and 20. Eenheid 1.2 Die kruisproduk Bron: Stewart, Section 12.4 pp 808 - 815 Leerdoelwitte Na voltooiing van hierdie eenheid moet jy 1. die definisie van die kruisproduk van twee vektore kan neerskryf en gebruik. 2. die kruisproduk van twee gegewe vektore kan bepaal. 3. die eienskappe van die kruisproduk kan neerskryf en gebruik. 4. die meetkundige betekenis van die kruisproduk kan verduidelik. Opmerkings 1. Die kruisproduk is slegs gedefinieer vir drie-dimensionele vektore. 2. Let op dat die volgorde van die vektore in die bepaling van die kruisproduk belangrik is. Die volgorde is nie belangrik wanneer die puntproduk bereken word nie. 3. Die inleiding tot determinante is slegs om dit makliker te maak om die kruisproduk te bereken. 4. Jy hoef geen bewyse te ken nie. Probleme Stewart, Exercises 12.4 p 815: No 3, 5, 7, 13 en 20. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 7 Unit 1.3 Lines and planes Source: Stewart, Section 12.5 pp 816 - 825 Learning outcomes: After completion of this lecture unit you must 1. be able to find the vector equation of a line in space. 2. be able to find the parametric equations of a line in space. 3. be able to find symmetric equations (where applicable) of a line in space. 4. know what direction numbers of a line are. 5. know what a normal vector of a plane is. 6. be able to find a vector equation of a plane in space. 7. be able to find a scalar equation (Cartesian equation) of a plane in space. 8. be able to determine whether two planes are parallel and if not, find the angle between the planes and determine the equation of the line of intersection. Remark Take note that if planes do not intersect they are parallel. This is not the case with lines. It is possible to find lines that are not parallel and do not intersect either. Look at Example 3 on p 819. Problems Stewart, Exercises 12.5 on p 824 no 1, 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, 11, 20, 21, 27, 30, 31, 45, 47, 61 and 67. Eenheid 1.3 Lyne en vlakke Bron: Stewart, Section 12.5 pp 816 - 825 Leeruitkomste: Na voltooiing van hierdie eenheid moet jy 1. ’n vektorvergelyking van ’n lyn in die ruimte kan bepaal. 2. parametriese vergelykings van ’n lyn in die ruimte kan bepaal. 3. simmetriese vergelykings (wanneer toepaslik) van ’n lyn in die ruimte kan bepaal. 4. weet wat rigtingsgetalle van ’n lyn is. 5. weet wat ’n normaalvektor van ’n vlak is. 6. ’n vektorvergelyking van ’n vlak in die ruimte kan bepaal. 7. ’n skalaarvergelyking (Cartesiese vergelyking) van ’n vlak in die ruimte kan bepaal. 8. kan vasstel of twee vlakke ewewydig is en indien nie, die hoek tussen die vlakke en die vergelyking van die snylyn kan bepaal. Opmerking Let op dat as vlakke nie sny nie, dan is hulle ewewydig. Dit is nie die geval met lyne nie. Dit is moontlik om lyne te kry wat nie ewewydig is nie en tog ook nie sny nie. Kyk na Voorbeeld 3 op p819. Probleme Stewart, Exercises 12.5 on p 824 no 1, 3, 4, 5, 9, 10, 11, 20, 21, 27, 30, 31, 45, 47, 61 en 67. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 8 THEME 2 SYSTEMS OF LINEAR EQUATIONS AND MATRICES Unit 2.1 Systems of linear equations Source: Larson 1.1 pp 2 - 12 Learning outcomes After completion of this lecture unit you must 1. know what a linear equation in n variables is and know what is meant by a system of equations. 2. know what is meant by the solution of a linear system. 3. know what is meant by the parametric representation of a solution set. 4. know that there are three possibilities for a system of linear equations : exactly one solution (consistent system), no solution (inconsistent system) or an infinite number of solutions (consistent system). 5. know what equivalent systems are. 6. know what operations on a system will render an equivalent system. 7. be able to explain the three cases geometrically in terms of lines and planes in two and three dimensions . 8. take note of the concepts of row echelon form, back substitution and elimination - we study these in more detail in the next unit. Remarks: Leave Examples 7, 8, 9 to do in the next unit - we study it in depth then. Problems : p10 no 1, 3, 7, 9, 37, 40, 67, 68, 79, 80. TEMA 2 STELSELS LINEÊRE VERGELYKINGS EN MATRIKSE Eenheid 2.1 Stelsels lineêre vergelykings Bron: Larson 1.1 pp 2 - 12 Leeruitkomste Na afhandeling van hierdie lesingeenheid moet jy 1. weet wat ’n lineêre vergelyking in n veranderlikes is en weet wat bedoel word met ’n stelsel vergelykings. 2. weet wat bedoel word met die oplossing van ’n lineêre stelsel. 3. weet wat bedoel word met die parametriese voorstelling van ’n oplossingstel. 4. weet dat daar drie moontlikhede is vir ’n stelsel lineêre vergelykings : presies een oplossing (nie-strydige stelsel), geen oplossing (strydige stelsel) of oneindig veel oplossings (nie-strydige stelsel). 5. weet wat ekwivalente stelsels is. 6. weet watter bewerkings op ’n stelsel ’n ekwivalente stelsel lewer. 7. die drie gevalle vir twee-dimensionale en drie-dimensionale stelsels meetkundig kan verduidelik in terme van lyne en vlakke. 8. kennis neem van die begrippe: rytrapvorm, terug subsitusie en eliminasie - ons kyk in meer diepte daarna in die volgende eenheid. Opmerkings: Los Voorbeelde 7, 8, 9 om in die volgende eenheid te doen - ons bestudeer dit dan deeglik. Probleme : p10 no 1, 3, 7, 9, 37, 40, 67, 68, 79, 80. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 9 Unit 2.2 Gaussian elimination Source: Larson 1.2 pp 13 - 24 Learning outcomes After completion of this lecture unit you must 1. know the concepts matrix, m � n matrix, size of a matrix, entry, row, column, square matrix and its main diagonal, coefficient matrix and augmented matrix. 2. be able to write a system in the form of an augmented matrix. 3. know what the three elementary row operations are. 4. know that elementary row operations on the augmented matrix correspond to elementary row operations on the coresponding system of equations. 5. know what is meant by row echelon form and reduced row echelon form. 6. know the process of Gaussian elimination and back substitution. 7. be able to perform Gauss-Jordan elimination. 8. know how to determine the solution of a system with infinitely many solutions. 9. know what a homogeneous system is and that every homogeneous sytem is consistent. 10. be able to determine the number of solutions of a system given in row-echelon form and be able to calculate all the solutions by using back substitution. Problems : p22 no 8, 9, 11, 14, 17, 23 Gauss: 25, 29, 31, 37, Gauss-Jordan: 32, Other: 41, 42, 43, 44, 57, 59. Remark: Omit section 1.3 on p25. Look at the Review exercises on p35. Eenheid 2.2 Gauss-eliminasie Bron: Larson 1.2 pp13 - 24 Leeruitkomste Na afhandeling van hierdie lesingeenheid moet jy 1. die begrippe ken van matriks, m � n matriks, grootte van die matriks, inskrywing, ry, kolom, vierkantige matriks en sy hoof diagonaal, koëffisiënte matriks en aangevulde matriks. 2. ’n stelsel in die vorm van ’n aangevulde matriks kan skryf. 3. weet wat die drie elementêre rybewerkings is. 4. weet dat elementêre rybewerkings op ’n aangevulde matriks neerkom op elementêre rybewerkings vir die ooreenstemmende stelsel vergelykings. 5. weet wat met rytrapvorm en met gereduseerde rytrapvorm bedoel word. 6. die proses van Gauss eliminasie en terug substitusie ken. 7. Gauss-Jordan eliminasie kan doen. 8. weet hoe om die oplossings van ’n stelsel met oneindig veel oplossings te bepaal. 9. weet wat ’n homogene stelsel is en weet dat elke homogene stelsel nie-strydig is. 10. kan vasstel hoeveel oplossings ’n stelsel in trapvorm het en al die oplossings kan bereken deur terugsubstitusie te gebruik. Probleme: p22 no 8, 9, 11, 14, 17, 23 Gauss: 25, 29, 31, 37, Gauss-Jordan: 32, Ander: 41, 42, 43, 44, 57, 59 Opmerking: Los paragraaf 1.3 op p25. Kyk na die Hersieningsoefeninge op p35. wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 10 Unit 2.3 Matrix operations and properties Source: Larson 2.1 & 2.2 pp 40 - 61 Learning outcomes After completion of this lecture unit you must 1. know three ways of representing a matrix. 2. know the definition of equality of two matrices. 3. know the definitions of matrix addition, scalar multiplication, matrix multiplication and be able to perform these calculations. 4. be able to write a system of linear equations by using matrix multplication. 5. be able to partition a matrix. 6. know the properties of matrix addition and matrix multiplication. 7. know what the null matrix is and know that an m � n null matrix the additive identity is for m � n matrices. 8. know the properties of the null matrix. 9. know that �A is the additive inverse of A. 10. be able to solve matrix equations that involve addition and scalar multiplication. 11. know the properties of matrix multiplication. 12. know that matrix multiplication is associative but not commutative. 13. know that the cancellation property does not necessairily hold. 14. know what the identity matrix of order n is and know the properties thereof. 15. know that for a square matrix the same exponent notation can be used as for real numbers. 16. know what the transpose of a matrix is and know the properties of transposes. 17. know when a matrix is symmetric. 18. be able to use matrix properties in problem solving Remarks: Omit the section on partitioned matrices on p46. Problems : p48 no 3, 10, 13, 14, 26, 27, 29, 34, 38, 41, 55, 57, 68, 79 p 59 no 13, 15, 19, 23, 25, 31, 35, 42, 52, 53, 73(a) wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 11 Eenheid 2.3 Matriksbewerkings en eienskappe Bron: Larson 2.1 & 2.2 pp 40 - 61 Leeruitkomste Na afhandeling van hierdie lesingeenheid moet jy 1. die drie maniere ken om ’n matriks voor te stel. 2. die definisie van gelykheid van twee matrikse ken. 3. die definisies van matriksoptelling, skalaarvermenigvuldiging en matriksvermenigvuldiging ken en die bewerkings kan uitvoer. 4. ’n stelsel lineêre vergelykings as ’n matriksvergelyking kan skryf deur van matriksvermenigvuldiging gebruik te maak. 5. ’n matriks kan partisioneer. 6. die eienskappe van matriksoptelling en skalaarvermenigvuldiging ken. 7. weet wat ’n nulmatriks is en weet dat ’n m � n nulmatriks die optellingsidentiteit vir m � n matrikse is. 8. die eienskappe van nulmatrikse ken. 9. weet dat �A die optellingsinverse van A is. 10. matriksvergelykings wat optelling en skalaarvermenigvuldiging behels, kan oplos. 11. die eienskappe van matriksvermenigvuldiging ken. 12. weet dat matriksvermenigvuldiging assosiatief is, maar nie kommutatief is nie. 13. weet dat die kansellasie-eienskap nie noodwendig geld nie. 14. weet wat ’n identiteitsmatriks van orde n is en die eienskappe daarvan ken. 15. weet dat vir vierkantige matrikse dieselfde eksponent-notasie as vir reële getalle gebruik kan word. 16. weet wat die getransponeerde van ’n matriks is en die eienskappe van getransponeerdes ken. 17. weet wanneer ’n matriks simmetries is. 18. in staat wees om eienskappe van matrikse in probleemoplossing te gebruik. Opmerkings: Los die gedeelte oor gepartisioneerde matrikse op p46. Probleme: p48 no 3, 10, 13, 14, 26, 27, 29, 34, 38, 41, 55, 57, 68, 79 p 59 no 13, 15, 19, 23, 25, 31, 35, 42, 52, 53, 73(a) wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 12 Unit 2.4 The inverse of a square matrix Source: Larson 2.3 pp 62 - 73 Learning outcomes After completion of this lecture unit you must 1. know the definition of an invertible (non-singular) matrix. 2. know that the inverse of a matrix is unique and know the notation for it. 3. be able to calculate the inverse of a matrix (if it exists) by using Gauss-Jordan elimination. 4. know the formula for calculating the inverse of an invertible 2 � 2 matrix. 5. know the properties of inverses. 6. know what the property of the inverse of a product of matrices is. 7. know when the cancellation property holds. 8. be able to use the inverse to solve matrix equations. 9. know what is meant by a singular matrix. Remarks: 1. You need to be able to solve a larger variety of matrix equations than given in the textbook, eg. Solve for X : (i) A2X � I � AB (ii) AXB � B � A (iii) A�X � I�A � B 2. Omit Sections 2.4 and 2.5, notes will be given on elementary matrices. 3. Look at the Review exercises on p 98. Problems : p71 no 2, 9, 16, 17, 31, 41, 46, 53, 57, 63, 69, 78. Eenheid 2.4 Die inverse van ’n vierkantige matriks Bron: Larson 2.3 pp 62 - 73 Leeruitkomste Na afhandeling van hierdie lesingeenheid moet jy 1. die definisie ken van ’n inverteerbare matriks. 2. weet dat die inverse van ’n matriks eenduidig is en die notasie daarvan ken. 3. die inverse van ’n matriks kan bereken (as dit bestaan) mbv Gauss-Jordan eliminasie. 4. die formule ken om die inverse van ’n 2 � 2 inverteerbare matriks te bereken. 5. die eienskappe van inverses ken. 6. weet wat die eienskap van die inverse van ’n produk van matrikse is. 7. weet wanneer die kansellasie-eienskappe geld. 8. die inverse kan gebruik om matriksvergelykings op te los. 9. weet wat met ’n singuliere matriks bedoel word. Opmerkings: 1. Jy moet ’n groter verskeidenheid van matriksvergelykings kan oplos as wat in die handboek gegee word, bv. Los op vir X : (i) A2X � I � AB (ii) AXB � B � A (iii) A�X � I�A � B 2. Los paragrawe 2.4 en 2.5, aantekeinge sal oor elementêre matrikse gegee word. 3. Kyk na die Hersieningsoefeninge op p98. Probleme: p71 no 2, 9, 16, 17, 31, 41, 46, 53, 57, 63, 69, 78 wtw 161 studyguide 2010 p 13 Unit 2.5 The determinant of a matrix Source: Larson 3.1 & 3.2 pp 103 - 119 Learning outcomes After completion of this lecture unit you must 1. know the definition of the determinant of a 2 � 2 matrix. 2. know the definitions of a minor and a cofactor of a matrix. 3. know the definition of the determinant of a square matrix of order n. 4. be able to calculate the determinant of a 3 � 3 and a 4 � 4 matrix. 5. know how to calculate the determinant of a (upper or lower) triangular matrix. 6. know what the effect of elementary row operations is on the determinant of a matrix. 7. be able to use row operations to calculate a determinant. 8. know that row operations and column operations have the same effect on determinants. 9. know conditions that result in a zero determinant.
